{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3391057,"name":"Gal","username":"GalDotan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/galdotan/{size}/201749_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-23T15:57:07.622Z","cooked":"

Our team is looking to up our vision game. One of the things on our list is to do reliable game piece detection. What should we start with Limeligth 3 runing PV or Orange PI 5 and some sort of global shutter camera?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-05-23T15:57:07.622Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":131,"reads":203,"readers_count":202,"score":695.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":466810,"topic_slug":"orange-pi-5-vs-limelight-3-fro-object-detection","display_username":"Gal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60986,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5951 Software and electrical lead"},"post_url":"/t/orange-pi-5-vs-limelight-3-fro-object-detection/466810/1","custom_user_title":"5951 Software and electrical lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3391062,"name":"Kaleb Dodd","username":"Kaleb_Dodd","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kaleb_dodd/{size}/7859_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-23T16:03:03.444Z","cooked":"

We used LL3 with the limelight software, just using normal HSV colour detection for the notes this year for CMP, was a huge improvement in auto reliability but it does need to be tuned to work at each fields lighting situation. Depending on the game piece colour can work pretty reliably but if something was red or blue like in 2022 you have to be careful about tracking other robots bumpers.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-05-23T16:03:03.444Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":199,"readers_count":198,"score":54.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":466810,"topic_slug":"orange-pi-5-vs-limelight-3-fro-object-detection","display_username":"Kaleb Dodd","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23840,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/orange-pi-5-vs-limelight-3-fro-object-detection/466810/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3391063,"name":"Parsly","username":"YourFriendlyCoder","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/y/bcef8e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-23T16:06:30.024Z","cooked":"

If you are just starting, I’d recommend a Limelight (using the Limelight software) since there’s such a low barrier of entry and tons of documentation online to help you with any questions you have. With a Limelight, if you want reliable game piece detection I’d recommend you use a Google Coral TPU since you’d be able to use machine learning to detect several game pieces rather on relying on the color of the game piece.

I have heard that there are some reliability issues with the limelight 3 and google coral. Did you encounter any of those?

Depends what you mean by “reliability issues”, I worked with for a while and only really saw that there are times when the robot is speeding by and/or some distance away from a game piece that it couldn’t see it.

This might be useful.

Introducing Limelight 3 General Forum
@Jack_1221 @fedorlspp26 @jdao @BoxOfScraps @Kalimbus @Joel_Singh AprilTags and Coral-accelerated models work on LL1, LL2, and LL2+. Object detection models will run at 20-30fps on older hardware as opposed to 45-60fps on LL3. Classification models run at 90fps on LL3, and I believe 60fps on older hardware. H.264 streaming is the only feature exclusive to LL3.
","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-05-23T16:27:29.758Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":140,"readers_count":139,"score":58.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":466810,"topic_slug":"orange-pi-5-vs-limelight-3-fro-object-detection","display_username":"Parsly","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/introducing-limelight-3/421087/40","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Introducing Limelight 3","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":60986,"username":"GalDotan","name":"Gal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/galdotan/{size}/201749_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64673,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"'); DROP TABLE users;"},"post_url":"/t/orange-pi-5-vs-limelight-3-fro-object-detection/466810/9","custom_user_title":"'); DROP TABLE users;","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3391097,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-23T16:46:09.446Z","cooked":"

Running a note detection model on an Orange Pi 5 is extremely easy. Just plug in any color camera, flash the Orange Pi according to the Photonvision instructions, and power it on. Then select the object detection pipeline.

You do not need any additional hardware. I got 30fps on my 30fps Lifecam, but I don’t know the maximum processing speed. It’s highly model-dependent. All models run at 640x480 (I believe this is the same for the LL).

You can run normal AprilTag pipelines at the same time “for free”, as the NPU operates almost independently of the main processor.
